document_data.name: Drawn Swords
document_data.mainbody: '''Drawn Swords''' was an isolated village found in the [[Backlands]] of the [[Western Heartlands]]. The settlement was named for the vigilance and mind for defense that was demanded of all of its residents, thanks to the assaults it suffered on regular basis.
document_data.Description: The village sat atop a single rocky hill that overlooked the surrounding landscape. Rows of cottages were built in rings along the sides of the hill ascended upward towards a small copse of trees that surrounded the tower of [[Swordskeep]].
document_data.Geography:
Drawn Swords was located east of the [[Reaching Woods]], approximately equidistant between [[Hill's Edge]] along the [[River Reaching]] to the south, and the [[Hill of Lost Souls]] to the north; and northwest of [[Skull Gorge]].

Between the village and Skull Gorge was a monument created by local [[mountain giant]]s called [[Fallen Giant Tomb]].
document_data.Trade: All manner of exotic goods came through Drawn Swords, which was surprisingly given its distance from any major trade roads or nearby settlements.
document_data.Defenses: At least half the villagers of Drawn Swords were well-trained in archery, and used the town's elevated to aid in its defense. They hung [[quiver]]s of arrows just inside the doors of many buildings, and trained in firing volleys together as they worked their way towards Swordskeep tower for greater advantage.
document_data.History:
Throughout history a number of battles have been fought on the hill atop which Drawn Swords was built. It was constantly being attacked by outsiders,

As of the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]], worshipers of [[Sune]] would regularly make offerings to their goddess in town, accompanied by the [[Stag Warriors]] of the nearby [[Flame Grove]].
document_data.Rumors & Legends: It was rumored that the town was protected by the group known as the [[Harpers]] and that one of their members owned its resident [[Sword and Dragon]] inn. Stories tell that the Harpers took interest in Drawn Swords and constructed the inn within Swordskeep tower to hide and protect a ''[[portal]]'' that linked it with the city of [[Berdusk]].
document_data.Notable Locations:
* [[Swordskeep]], a ruined tower that provided protection to the town's residents.
* [[Sword and Dragon]], a pleasant-enough establishment that was always packed with adventurers and owned by some mysterious [[Berdusk]]an business owner.
document_data.Inhabitants: Despite its small size and relative isolation, Drawn Swords was the meeting place for several [[adventurer|adventuring]] parties, notable among them [[Saern's Sharp Swords]].
